p: When forecasting season s from data source d, we estimate prior distributions for each of these characteristics from historical observed seasonal data, using all seasons of d except s: a set of possible shape curves, a range of peak height values, a range of peak week values, and a set of noise values. For example, when making an out-of-sample forecast of the 2007-2008 flu season, we build our prior distributions using all seasons for which data are available preceding and following 2007-2008. For ILINet, this would include all seasons between 2003 and 2014, except 2007-2008; for Athena, this would include only seasons between 2011 and 2014.
